snippet: Cardinal Roger Mahony, the former archbishop of Los Angeles, insisted that his approach to sexual abuse had evolved as he learned more over the years.
abstract: Internal personnel files on 124 priests released by the archdiocese of Los Angeles under court order suggest that retired Cardinal Roger M Mahony and other top church officials were slow to respond to accusations of abuse, and that they often acted to protect priests; Mahony defends himself vehemently from censure by his successor Jose H Gomez, suggesting that his approach to sexual abuse has evolved significantly over the years.

byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA and LAURIE GOODSTEIN
byline.contributor: Jennifer Medina reported from Los Angeles, and Laurie Goodstein from New York. Ian Lovett contributed reporting from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Cardinal Roger Mahony, the former archbishop of Los Angeles, insisted that his approach to sexual abuse had evolved as he learned more over the years.

headline.seo: Church Documents Released After Years of Resistance
headline.main: Diocese Papers in Los Angeles Detail Decades of Abuse
